intro: Jasione propullulans, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are bell-shaped, usually blue or purple, and bloom in late spring to early summer. Jasione propullulans is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often found in wildflower gardens.
